Class SimplePlayer

    public class SimplePlayer
extends AbstractPlayer
    This class implements an AI with the simple strategy

      • requestMove

        protected Move requestMove()
                    throws java.lang.Exception,
                           java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method returns the next move that this player makes next. The moves of the Gamephase One are randomly chosen with randLinkLinkMove(possMoves, size of possMoves). The moves for the other phases are carefully chosen by predicting enemy reactions with moveMinMax.
        Specified by:
        requestMove in class AbstractPlayer
        Returns:
        next move the AI wants to make
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - of anykind
        java.rmi.RemoteException - when the network play is interrupted

                              int size)
        This method choses a random move to be made for the AI
        Parameters:
        moves - List of available moves
        size - size of the List
        Returns:
        random move to be made

      • connectedContextComponent

        private void connectedContextComponent(Node agent,
                                       java.util.LinkedList<Node> conComp)
        This method constructs the connected component of the given agent and stores it in the given list. The paradigm of tge Depth First Search is used to do this.
        Parameters:
        agent - whose connected component is to be cunstructed
        conComp - list where connected component is to be stored

      • calculateConnectedComponent

        private void calculateConnectedComponent(Node agent,
                                         java.util.LinkedList<Node> conComp,
                                         GameBoard copy)
        This method constructs the connected component of the specified agent with connectedContextComponent(agent, conComp) and makes the sites white again with makeSitesWhiteAgain.
        Parameters:
        agent - whose connected component is to be cunstructed
        conComp - list where connected component is to be stored
        copy - deep copy of gameboard on which the moves for the AI are calculated

      • contextComponentWeight

        private int contextComponentWeight(java.util.LinkedList<Node> conComp,
                                   GameBoard copy)
        This method returns the weight of the given connected component
        Parameters:
        conComp - connected component to be weighted
        copy - deep copy of gameboard on which the moves for the AI are calculated
        Returns:

      • checkMin

        private void checkMin(GameSituation newSit)

        Parameters:

      • moveMinMax

        private Move moveMinMax()
        This method returns the next move the AI wants to make. To pinpoint which move the AI wants to do by utilizing outterLoop and innerLoop.
        Returns:
        move to be made

      • outterLoop

        private Move outterLoop(GameBoard copy)
        This method is given a deep copy of the GameBoard to simulate moves to determine which move would be good given the current Situation. It tests all the moves that the AI can make and utilizes innerLoop to test the possible enemy reations of a simulated move. A move is returned early if the tested move leads to a win for the AI. The innerLoop is skipped if the simulated move leads to a lose for the AI. The method rollBackMove is used to reverte a made move.
        Parameters:
        copy - deep copy of the gameboard on which to simulate the moves
        Returns:
        move the AI wants to make

      • innerLoop

        private void innerLoop(Move selfMove,
                       GameBoard copy)
        This method is called from outterLoop to simulate enemy reaction moves of the passed selfMove. If the enemy move leads to the enemy winning, than this selfMove is given a bad rating packed into a GameSituation and passed to checkMin(GameSituation) and returned to outterLoop. Otherwise the gameSituation is used to get a rating for the selfMove, packed into a GameSituation and given to checkMin(GameSituation). rollBackMove is used to revert the simulated enemy moves.
        Parameters:
        selfMove - move that the AI made
        copy - deep copy of gameboard on which the moves are simulated

      • gameSituation

        private int gameSituation(GameBoard copy)
        This method constructs the connected component of both the AI and the enemy with calculateConnectedComponent. These are weighted with contextComponentWeight() The weight of the enemy is than substracted from the weight of the AI and in doing so create a rating for the Situation that the simulated selfMove.
        Parameters:
        copy - deep copy of the gameboard on which the moves are simulated
        Returns:
        rating for simulated selfMove
